board

Class AbstractBoard<T extends AbstractPiece>

  • java.lang.Object
    • board.AbstractBoard<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Generic Type. The type must extend Abstract Piece
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BigDecimalBoard, BigIntegerBoard, BooleanBoard, CharBoard, DoubleBoard, GameBoard, IntBoard, StringBoard

    public abstract class AbstractBoard<T extends AbstractPiece>
extends java.lang.Object
    The Abstract Board class is a custom made data-structure, which allows easy access of "pieces" by retrieval functions.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected T[][] board
      the board object to allocate in the constructor
      protected int horizontal_size
      The horizontal size of the board
      protected int vertical_size
      The vertical size of the board

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractBoard

        public AbstractBoard(int i,
             int j)
        To utilize this constructor, allocate a 2-dimensional array of objects that extends abstract piece.
        Example usage: 
         
 for(int i = 0; i < 7; i++)
 {
                for(int j = 0; j < 7; j++)
        
                {
                        board = new StringPiece("ThisIsAString", i, j);
        
                }
 }
        Some example implementations include:
        See Also:
        BooleanBoard, CharBoard, IntBoard, DoubleBoard, BigDecimalBoard, BigIntegerBoard, StringBoard
